identifier.$comment: FIX SPEC: Conforms to spec, but this MAY be an array of strings. FIXME: Rename to local identifier
identifier.title: Local dataset identifier

title.title: Dataset title
title.description: Name of the dataset limited to 80 characters. It should provide a short description of the dataset and be unique across the gateway. If your title is not unique, please add a prefix with your organisation name or identifier to differentiate it from other datasets within the Gateway. Please avoid acronyms wherever possible. Good titles should summarise the content of the dataset and if relevant, the region the dataset covers.

abstract.title: Dataset abstract
abstract.description: Provide a clear and brief descriptive signpost for researchers who are searching for data that may be relevant to their research. The abstract should allow the reader to determine the scope of the data collection and accurately summarise its content. The optimal length is one paragraph (limited to 255 characters) and effective abstracts should avoid long sentences and abbreviations where possible

publisher.$comment: Conforms to spec, but this MAY be an an object of organisation
publisher.title: Dataset publisher
publisher.description: This is the organisation responsible for running or supporting the data access request process, as well as publishing and maintaining the metadata. In most this will be the same as the HDR UK Organisation (Hub or Alliance Member). However, in some cases this will be different i.e. Tissue Directory are an HDR UK Gateway organisation but coordinate activities across a number of data publishers i.e. Cambridge Blood and Stem Cell Biobank.

contactPoint.title: The contactPoint schema
contactPoint.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

accessRights.$comment: FIXME: Conforms to spec, but this SHOULD be an array or URIs as cardinality is 1:*
accessRights.title: The accessRights schema
accessRights.description: The URL of a webpage where the data access request process and/or guidance is provided. If there is more than one access process i.e. industry vs academic please provide both. If such a resource or the underlying process doesn’t exist, please provide “In Progress”, until both the process and the documentation are ready.

group.$comment: Conforms to spec, but this MAY be an array of groups
group.title: The group schema
group.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

description.title: The description schema
description.description: A free-text account of the record. An html account of the data that provides context and scope of the data (limited to 50,000 characters) and/or a resolvable URL that describes the dataset.

media.$comment: FIXME: Conforms to spec, but this SHOULD to be an array of URIs as cardinality 0:*
media.title: The media schema
media.description: Please provide any media associated with the Gateway Organisation using a valid URI. This is an opportunity to provide additional context that could be useful for researchers wanting to undestand more about the dataset and its relevance to their research question. The following formats will be accepted .jpg, .png or .svg, .pdf, .xslx or .docx.

purpose.$comment: FIXME: Mandatory, but cardinality 0:* Possibly deprecate.
purpose.title: The purpose schema
purpose.description: Pleases indicate the purpose(s) that the dataset was collected. Multiple purposes may be provided

source.$comment: FIXME: Mandatory, but cardinality 0:* Possibly deprecate.
source.title: The source schema
source.description: Pleases indicate the source(s) that the dataset was collected. Multiple source(s) may be provided

setting.$comment: FIXME: Mandatory, but cardinality 0:*. Possibly deprecate.
setting.title: The setting schema
setting.description: Pleases indicate the setting(s) where data was collected. Multiple settings may be provided.

releaseDate.title: The releaseDate schema
releaseDate.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

accessRequestCost.title: The accessRequestCost schema
accessRequestCost.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

accessRequestDuration.title: The accessRequestDuration schema
accessRequestDuration.description: Please provide an indication of the typical processing times based on the types of requests typically received.

accessEnvironment.title: The accessEnvironment schema
accessEnvironment.description: Please provide a brief description of the data access environment that is currently available to researchers.

usageResrictions.$comment: FIXME: Missing from Onboarding tool, so not captured
usageResrictions.title: The usageResrictions schema
usageResrictions.description: Please provide a description of any usage restrictions of key terms and conditions under which access to the dataset is provided.

dataController.title: The dataController schema
dataController.description: Data Controller means a person/entity who (either alone or jointly or in common with other persons/entities) determines the purposes for which and the way any Data Subject data, specifically personal data or are to be processed.

dataProcessor.title: The dataProcessor schema
dataProcessor.description: A Data Processor, in relation to any Data Subject data, specifically personal data, means any person/entity (other than an employee of the data controller) who processes the data on behalf of the data controller.

license.title: The license schema
license.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

derivedDatasets.$comment: FIXME: Conforms to spec, but this SHOULD to be an array of datasets as cardinality 0:*
derivedDatasets.title: The derivedDatasets schema
derivedDatasets.description: Indicate if derived datasets or predefined extracts are available and the type of derivation available.

linkedDataset.$comment: FIXME: If linked $title must start with 'Linked'. FIXME: Conforms to spec, but this SHOULD to be an array of datasets as cardinality 0:*
linkedDataset.title: The linkedDataset schema
linkedDataset.description: If applicable, please provide the DOI of other datasets that have previously been linked to this dataset and their availability. If no DOI is available, please provide the title of the datasets that can be linked, where possible using the same title of a dataset previously onboarded.

linkageOpportunity.title: The linkageOpportunity schema
linkageOpportunity.description: If applicable, please indicate if there is the opportunity to link this dataset to additional data sources. If possible, please describe the data elements that could be used to link to external data sources i.e. region or postcode could be used to link to open datasets such as air pollution or deprivation indices. In addition, please describe the restricted data elements that cannot be used to link to other datasets.

geographicCoverage.title: The geographicCoverage schema
geographicCoverage.description: The geographical area covered by the dataset.

periodicity.title: The periodicity schema
periodicity.description: The frequency at which dataset is published.

datasetEndDate.title: The datasetEndDate schema
datasetEndDate.description: The end of the time period that the dataset provides coverage for.

datasetStartDate.title: The datasetStartDate schema
datasetStartDate.description: The start of the time period that the dataset provides coverage for.

jurisdiction.$comment: FIXME: Add ISO 3166-2 Subdivision code pattern
jurisdiction.title: The jurisdiction schema
jurisdiction.description: Please use country code from ISO 3166-1 country codes and the associated ISO 3166-2 for regions, cities, states etc. for the country/state under whose laws the data subjects’ data is collected, processed and stored.

populationType.$comment: FIXME: Check against SNOMED-CT TERMS. Conforms to spec but MAY be array of strings
populationType.title: The populationType schema
populationType.description: Please provide a valid SNOMED CT concept that describes the measure within the dataset i.e. participants in a study, modality, or images with certain characteristics.

disabmiguatingDescription.$comment: FIXME: Rename MDC response to ageRange according to spec
disabmiguatingDescription.title: The disabmiguatingDescription schema
disabmiguatingDescription.description: If SNOMED CT term does not provide sufficient detail, please provide a description that disambiguates the population type.

statisticalPopulation.$comment: FIXME: Spec calls this Measured Value
statisticalPopulation.title: The statisticalPopulation schema
statisticalPopulation.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

ageBand.$comment: FIXME: Rename MDC response to ageRange according to spec
ageBand.title: The ageBand schema
ageBand.description: Please indicate the age range in whole years of participants in the dataset. Please provide range in the following format ‘[min age] – [max age]’ where both the minimum and maximum are whole numbers (integers).

physicalSampleAvailability.title: The physicalSampleAvailability schema
physicalSampleAvailability.description: Availability of physical samples associated with the dataset. If samples are available, please indicate the types of samples that are available.

keywords.$comment: Conforms to spec, but this MAY be an array of strings
keywords.title: The keywords schema
keywords.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

conformsTo.title: The conformsTo schema
conformsTo.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

controlledVocabulary.$comment: FIXME: Confroms to spec, but MAY be a list of strings
controlledVocabulary.title: The controlledVocabulary schema
controlledVocabulary.description: List any relevant terminologies / ontologies / controlled vocabularies, such as ICD 10 Codes, NHS Data Dictionary National Codes or SNOMED CT International, that are being used by the dataset.

language.$comment: FIXME: Conforms to spec, but may be a list of strings given cardinality 1:*. Validate against external list of languages. Resources defined by the Library of Congress (ISO 639-1, ISO 639-2) SHOULD be used.
language.title: The language schema
language.description: This should list all the languages in which the dataset metadata and underlying data is made available.

format.$comment: FIXME: Conforms to spec, but may be a list of strings given cardinality 1:*. Validate against external list of formats, e.g. https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml
format.title: The format schema
format.description: If multiple formats are available please specify.

fileSize.title: The fileSize schema
fileSize.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

creator.title: The creator schema
creator.description: Please provide the text that you would like included as part of any citation that credits this dataset. This is typically just the name of the publisher. No employee details should be provided.

citations.$comment: FIXME: Conforms to spec, but may be a list of citation strings
citations.title: The citations schema
citations.description: Please provide the keystone paper associated with the dataset. Also include a list of known citations, if available and should be links to existing resources where the dataset has been used or referenced.

doi.title: Digital Object Identifier
doi.description: All HDR UK registered datasets should either have a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) or be working towards obtaining one. If a DOI is available, please provide the DOI.
